intro: Andryala crithmifolia subsp. crithmifolia, commonly known as sea holly, is a coastal plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers and aromatic, finely divided leaves. The plant thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in maritime environments. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for coastal gardens and rockeries.
